Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> @dukeleto hey man... May I ask why I got blocked on your Twitter? I am a fan of your work and was surprised to see it. Did I say something offensive?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiuCrypto i have a general policy to mute/block twitter accounts with more than 10K followers because usually they are purchased "influencer accounts" with no idea what they are talking about, or just posting self-serving info. You hit both categories

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But, in the interest of diplomacy, and so you can see my content, I changed you to Muted

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> While people constantly shill online about "anonsets" and "the most privacy", I am actually writing code that Does The Thing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so I mute and block freely on twitter, it's the only way to make it usable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I block/mute hundreds of accounts, don't worry, it wasn't personal, just business.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @halo kitty rules thanks, no worries about donations

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiuCrypto if you truly want to be the first "influencer" to talk about something new, tell people about Sietch: https://github.com/myhush/sietch

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiuCrypto ask Pirate what they are doing in response to these metadata attacks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiuCrypto ask them how is their work on this Zcash metadata bug that has been open for over a year: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/3606

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Sietch is drastic new tech to fight a new metadata war

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> nobody thought it was needed, but it is

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Plain Zcash Protocol is insecure.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Any coin can choose to add Sietch or something like it, if they don't, they have very little privacy, if any.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Amazingly, within a few days of me announcing Sietch (after being in the works for months), @denio implemented it in SDL! I had thought SDL could use the Sietch within hushd, but actually it uses raw xtns and needed it's own. Epic thanks to @denio !! If you want to thank somebody for helping the privacy of everybody, it's him. It's still doing final testing, but the next SDL with feature Sietch goodness

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I can't say enough good things about @denio and how much help he has provided as well as doing cool stuff completely on his own.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> @dukeleto thanks for clarification. Also for clarifucation: my twitter bio explicitly says "not an influencer" as I despise 99% of them and don't want to belong to that category üòÅ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> @dukeleto also thanks for the technical update and unblocking. It would be a shame to miss out o future developments

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> I am not a cultist of any single coin btw

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> Saying this because you mentioned pirate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> Yes, I love the project

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> But that doesn't mean I can't respect and hold others as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> Does the metadata leak result from z-TX THEMSELVES? Or is it indirectly because of the transparent tx of the ecosystem?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> @JiuCrypto unfurtionally the Meta Data leak is for every Project who use zaddr relevant. In short: every z-transaction can be linked with Metadata, that's why Hush use now Sietch to make it alot harder to do that. Amazing work by @dukeleto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> @denio that implies it is also affecting z-z only projects?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> But since Zcash coorperate with analyst companies, I guess they will not try to prevent  the leak

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Z-z more then optional

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> ok

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> It's all about linking data for analyst company's... And Hush makes that now much harder to do that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> Sounds about right. Has there been any statement by ZCash or ECC on the issues?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Like I said, Zec works together with such companies (if I remember correct they said this on Twitter). So I don't expect a statement from them. The Github issue Duke posted is a good start point for more research on that in  Zcash world

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> There are more Infos about the so called "ITM Attac" I guess. #deanon is also a good research start point

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> @denio thanks for the info

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> just catching up here

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiuCrypto the ITM attack is on z2z transactions themselves

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> any other metadata from taddrs just makes it much worse

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiuCrypto I helped create Pirate, I have more code into Pirate than just about anybody, except jl777. I have respect for them, they were the first z2z coin. Also, we must move forward and cannot sit on our laurels in privacy coin world. Every day presents new attacks, and the ITM attack is probably the worse attack against Zcash Protocol yet known

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ITM came up with it, so the specific attack he described we dubbed "the ITM metadata attack". Yes, naming things is hard.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Now, in working with him, we realize the attack is an entire new class of attacks and I dubbed that entire new class of attacks "Metaverse metadata attacks"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> none of it has been publicly described much, because I wanted to have Hush 3.3.0 out with mitigations first üôÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So Hush is the first and currently only coin with protection against these metadata attacks. I assume smart zcash forks will adopt Sietch or something like it, or continue to not care about their anonsets

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and yes, Hush can now measure it's anonset in real-time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the first Zcash coin to do that as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am seeing some issues with our explorer, remember we have this nice one too: https://hush3.komodod.com/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiuCrypto> @dukeleto thanks for all those infos!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Hush starting 2020 with a big bang. Nice to read these updates and am awaiting more public disclosure about the metadata attacks. Thank you Duke and denio and anyone esle involved for this gigantic step forward.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Duke, a lot of respect to you for coding for your legacy and morals. It's more and more clear as each month passes. Seriously, thank you. You can bring forth privacy tools/solutions that few can even dream of.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Eddy O thanks, that means a lot to me!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Eddy O so far this is probably the best thing to read to understand more about the metadata attacks: https://github.com/myhush/sietch

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```
$ ./hush-cli getchaintxstats|grep shielded_tx_percent|head -n1
  "shielded_tx_percent": 0.06819778273218703,```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that means we have had 6.8% of transactions contain a zaddr in the last month of Hush mainnet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is the first Zcash Protocol coin to ever get these stats in real-time
